sentences.sContent: Frances achieved very good exam results.
sentences.sCn: 弗朗西丝考试取得了优异成绩。

sentences.sContent: Wilson has achieved considerable success as an artist.
sentences.sCn: 威尔逊作为一名艺术家成就斐然。

sentences.sContent: She eventually achieved her goal of becoming a professor.
sentences.sCn: 她终于实现目标，当上了教授。

sentences.sContent: ...enabling the children to follow and achieve spiritual development...
...it is the actor not the talker who can achieve the goal...
...A true leader is someone who develops his or her team so that they can and do hit their targets and achieve their goals...
...it can't really achieve any economies of scale on labor to save money when other expenses go up...
...but without them it will not be simple at all to achieve further goals...
...We want many of the same things as liberals—less poverty, more health care--but have radically different ideas on how to achieve it...
...correct spelling is so important that both students and the teachers should spare no efforts to achieve correct spelling...
...A few words about merit-based aid: Merit-based aid is aid offered to students who achieve excellence in a given area...

words.tran: 可完成的；可有成就的；做得成的

trans.tranOther: to successfully complete something or get a good result, especially by working hard
